episodes.overview: Massachusetts' cannabis industry is trying to make the market fair for people most harmed by marijuana prohibition, and they're turning to delivery. VICE News looks at the rollout.

episodes.name: Tuesday, February 9, 2021
episodes.overview: Lummi Nation is participating in a COVID-19 vaccine trial—a first for the tribe. VICE News looks at why some members feel representation is important and others remain skeptical.

episodes.name: Wednesday, February 10, 2021
episodes.overview: The Sinaloa cartel is enlisting unemployed Americans to move drugs over the border with Mexico. VICE News speaks with cartel members and smugglers adapting to pandemic conditions.

episodes.name: Thursday, February 11, 2021
episodes.overview: Law enforcement in Cobb County, Georgia, has a long-strained relationship with the community. VICE News follows the new progressive sheriff as he tries to unravel the distrust.

episodes.name: Tuesday, February 16, 2021
episodes.overview: Recent megafires have devastated a massive wetland in Brazil. VICE News surveys the damage and meets people trying to save iconic and endangered species.

episodes.name: Wednesday, February 17, 2021
episodes.overview: Lebanon is legalizing cannabis cultivation for medical purposes to save its failing economy. VICE News talks with local growers, skeptical about the government's moves.

episodes.name: Thursday, February 18, 2021
episodes.overview: New Orleans cancelled Mardi Gras parades this year, but that didn't kill the party. VICE News visits some locals who've turned their houses into "floats" for the celebration.

episodes.name: Monday, February 22, 2021
episodes.overview: The pandemic economy. Single mothers are suffering from job loss, childcare burdens, and now, evictions. VICE News reports on how the crisis is impacting women across the country.

episodes.name: Tuesday, February 23, 2021
episodes.overview: As wildfires tore through parts of Oregon, the state’s only women’s prison was evacuated. VICE animates the story from one inmate who says they had to riot to get basic essentials.

episodes.name: Wednesday, February 24, 2021
episodes.overview: Democrats’ losses in South Carolina paved the way for a new controversial anti-abortion bill. VICE heads to S.C. as anti-choice activists hope to get the bill to the Supreme Court.

episodes.name: Thursday, February 25, 2021
episodes.overview: Migrant deportations to Haiti grow in the weeks since President Biden was sworn in. VICE is on the ground, amid violent political clashes, as the latest repatriation flight landed.

episodes.name: Monday, March 1, 2021
episodes.overview: Women of color and female business owners are feeling the pandemic's economic toll at disproportionate rates. VICE News joins one Venezuelan-American as she closes her restaurant.

episodes.name: Tuesday, March 2, 2021
episodes.overview: St. George, Utah, is fighting to build a water pipeline to its booming desert community, but activists say that would jeopardize the entire region. VICE News hears both sides.

episodes.name: Wednesday, March 3, 2021
episodes.overview: African Americans are disproportionately affected by COVID-19 but are also less likely to get a vaccine. VICE News goes to Tuskegee, Alabama, to explore the history of hesitancy.

episodes.name: Thursday, March 4, 2021
episodes.overview: Kedren Community Health Center serves people of color in South Los Angeles, and is taking the reins to vaccinate those who may otherwise be left behind. VICE News visits.

episodes.name: Monday, March 8, 2021
episodes.overview: Somalia could fall into a dangerous new chapter in its war against Al-Shabaab. VICE News goes to the frontline to see how Somali forces are trying to hold things together.

episodes.name: Tuesday, March 9, 2021
episodes.overview: Mexican drug cartels in Michoacán have been at war for nearly 15 years. VICE News has the first-ever on-camera interview with a high-ranking member of the Jalisco Cartel.

episodes.name: Wednesday, March 10, 2021
episodes.overview: Haiti is in crisis as thousands protest rising crime and corruption under President Jovenel Moise. VICE News hears from the President and the people fighting to get rid of him.

episodes.name: Thursday, March 11, 2021
episodes.overview: The Biden administration is rolling back policies that kept some migrants stuck in Mexico. VICE News is with the first wave of migrants processed in Texas and others left behind.

episodes.name: Monday, March 15, 2021
episodes.overview: A year after Breonna Taylor’s killing, new legislation in Kentucky could actually clamp down on protesters, while protecting police. VICE News looks at the state’s response.

episodes.name: Tuesday, March 16, 2021
episodes.overview: Amazon workers at a warehouse in Alabama are casting ballots in a vote that could lead to the company's first union. VICE News talks to workers about what pushed them to organize.

episodes.name: Wednesday, March 17, 2021
episodes.overview: Some people in Jackson, Mississippi, have been without safe water for nearly a month. VICE News hears from residents who feel they've been abandoned.

episodes.name: Thursday, March 18, 2021
episodes.overview: Biden suspended oil leases on federal land, but in New Mexico that could mean a crisis for education funding. VICE News looks at how Democrats are trying to balance ambitions.

episodes.name: Monday, March 22, 2021
episodes.overview: Health care workers in some rural areas are getting creative to get people vaccinated. VICE News goes to Arkansas to look at the rollout in medically underserved communities.

episodes.name: Tuesday, March 23, 2021
episodes.overview: Germany's vaccine rollout has been sluggish, even though it handled the pandemic better than others. VICE News looks at what's stalling distribution and how Germans feel about it.

episodes.name: Wednesday, March 24, 2021
episodes.overview: Residents of Centreville, Illinois, are fighting to get their failing drainage and sewer systems fixed. VICE News investigates why local officials haven't made the needed repairs.

episodes.name: Thursday, March 25, 2021
episodes.overview: For-profit reform schools are big business in Utah, but some former students are alleging abuse. VICE News speaks with survivors who are organizing and calling for change.

episodes.name: Monday, March 29, 2021
episodes.overview: A new bill in Alabama would criminalize medical treatment for transgender minors. VICE News hears from a doctor fighting the bill and from teens caught in the political battle.

episodes.name: Tuesday, March 30, 2021
episodes.overview: Puerto Rico has some of the highest rates of femicide, domestic abuse, and violence against trans women. VICE News hears from survivors and activists demanding change.

episodes.name: Wednesday, March 31, 2021
episodes.overview: Asian Americans are speaking out against hate crimes and finding ways to protect their communities. VICE News speaks with a survivor of an attack and activists in New York City.

episodes.name: Thursday, April 1, 2021
episodes.overview: The first week of Derek Chauvin's trial has been emotional, as witnesses recalled George Floyd and his last moments. VICE News reviews the evidence and testimony so far.

episodes.name: Monday, April 5, 2021
episodes.overview: Serbia has a high vaccination rate, partly because Russia and China are vying for influence there. VICE News sees how media and conspiracies play into vaccine diplomacy.

episodes.name: Tuesday, April 6, 2021
episodes.overview: Jakarta's silver people are risking their health with toxic paint to support their families. VICE News follows some of these people trying to survive in a struggling economy.

episodes.name: Wednesday, April 7, 2021
episodes.overview: The conflict in Nagorno-Karabakh is officially over, but the dangerous clean-up work is just beginning. VICE News joins a team defusing bombs throughout the region.

episodes.name: Thursday, April 8, 2021
episodes.overview: Rebels in the Central African Republic are trying to overthrow the government, and civilians are caught in between. VICE News speaks with leaders on both sides.

episodes.name: Monday, April 12, 2021
episodes.overview: Bosnia and Herzegovina's constitution splits power along ethnic lines, but a small multi-ethnic party is trying to change that. VICE News looks at efforts to bridge the divide.

episodes.name: Tuesday, April 13, 2021
episodes.overview: Amazon workers in Alabama voted down a bid to organize the company's first union in the U.S. VICE News goes back to see what's next for the workers.

episodes.name: Wednesday, April 14, 2021
episodes.overview: Some Republicans are playing politics with the border crisis. VICE News rides along with Republican lawmakers touring the border and blaming the crisis on President Biden.

episodes.name: Thursday, April 15, 2021
episodes.overview: A new gun-control bill would expand background checks, but communities experiencing gun violence say it's not so simple. VICE News talks to activists trying to educate lawmakers.

episodes.name: Monday, April 19, 2021
episodes.overview: The Afghan government and military are preparing for the full withdrawal of U.S. troops by September. VICE News looks at what's next for Afghanistan as it deals with the Taliban.

episodes.name: Tuesday, April 20, 2021
episodes.overview: A Minneapolis jury has convicted former officer Derek Chauvin in the death of George Floyd, on all three charges. VICE News looks at what's next, including sentencing.

episodes.name: Wednesday, April 21, 2021
episodes.overview: America's most iconic fast-food chain is facing allegations of sexual harassment and systemic racism. VICE News talks with former workers and franchise owners suing McDonald's.

episodes.name: Thursday, April 22, 2021
episodes.overview: Nearly a year after the death of George Floyd, has anything changed in Minneapolis? VICE News speaks with activists and local leaders trying to reimagine and reform policing.

episodes.name: Monday, April 26, 2021
episodes.overview: The DOJ is now investigating the Louisville Metro Police Department. VICE News looks at LMPD’s pattern of questionable policing, and investigates the night David McAtee died.

episodes.name: Tuesday, April 27, 2021
episodes.overview: Children have endured six years of war in Yemen—displaced, targeted, some even forced to take up arms. VICE News witnesses the impact in a special report: Yemen's Children of War.

episodes.name: Wednesday, April 28, 2021
episodes.overview: Tanzania's government is in denial about COVID-19: it has stopped updating data, declined vaccines, and endorsed herbal remedies as cures. VICE News looks at the human toll.

episodes.name: Thursday, April 29, 2021
episodes.overview: VICE News Tonight cuts through the spin, disinformation, and punditry to bring you in-depth coverage of the day's top stories, and fearless on-the-ground reporting on the people, places and voices you won't see anywhere else.

episodes.name: Monday, May 3, 2021
episodes.overview: India's second wave has become totally unmanageable, as hospitals turn away patients, oxygen runs low, and bodies are burned en masse. VICE News witnesses India's COVID-19 hell.

episodes.name: Tuesday, May 4, 2021
episodes.overview: Biden promised to reunite families, but some of his immigration policies are working against that effort. VICE News follows a father and son facing a new age of family separation.

episodes.name: Wednesday, May 5, 2021
episodes.overview: A new $5 billion package offers Black farmers a chance at survival, but some officials don’t think they deserve it. VICE News looks at the history of discrimination at the USDA.

episodes.name: Thursday, May 6, 2021
episodes.overview: Weed is being legalized state by state, but that’s not the case in pro wrestling. VICE gets up close & personal with former WWE Champion Rob Van Dam as he fights to normalize pot.

episodes.name: Monday, May 10, 2021
episodes.overview: Hundreds of Palestinians were injured after Israeli forces stormed Jerusalem’s largest mosque. VICE News reports on the escalating tensions.

episodes.name: Tuesday, May 11, 2021
episodes.overview: Arkansas is the first state to ban gender-affirming healthcare for transgender minors. VICE News speaks with trans youth in the state to hear what it means for them.

episodes.name: Wednesday, May 12, 2021
episodes.overview: The Biden Administration has been flying thousands of migrants from the Rio Grande Valley in Texas to San Diego — to then expel them to Tijuana. VICE News reports from the border.

episodes.name: Thursday, May 13, 2021
episodes.overview: Michael Moynihan takes VICE News on a road trip through Texas to ask conservative voters something conservative politicians can’t seem to figure out: what's the future of the GOP?

episodes.name: Monday, May 17, 2021
episodes.overview: Israel's bombardment on Gaza has killed more than 200 Palestinians, as it tries to crush Hamas. VICE News investigates the East Jerusalem legal battle behind the latest bloodshed.

episodes.name: Tuesday, May 18, 2021
episodes.overview: New Mexico's public schools have been closed since the pandemic began. VICE News follows some seniors as they head back to class and back onto the field, savoring every moment.

episodes.name: Wednesday, May 19, 2021
episodes.overview: VICE News Tonight cuts through the spin, disinformation, and punditry to bring you in-depth coverage of the day's top stories, and fearless on-the-ground reporting on the people, places and voices you won't see anywhere else.

episodes.name: Thursday, May 20, 2021
episodes.overview: Across the Central African Republic, civilians are alleging rape and torture by the Wagner group, the Russian organisation doing Putin's bidding globally. VICE News investigates.

episodes.name: Monday, May 24, 2021
episodes.overview: Biking to the future. VICE News follows two solo-preneurs creating a post pandemic reality: serving those who choose sustainable transportation.

episodes.name: Tuesday, May 25, 2021
episodes.overview: It's been one year since George Floyd was murdered by a police officer. In a special report, VICE News reflects with Floyd's brother and examines protesting and policing in America.

episodes.name: Wednesday, May 26, 2021
episodes.overview: Women in ICE custody were allegedly given unneeded, non-consensual gynecologic surgeries and then scheduled for deportation. In a special report, VICE News investigates.

episodes.name: Thursday, May 27, 2021
episodes.overview: Colombia is in the midst of an uprising, and the state has responded with deadly violence. VICE News reports from the front line in Cali.

episodes.name: Tuesday, June 1, 2021
episodes.overview: Parents in Pasco County, Florida, are suing their sheriff over a program they say predicts if kids will become criminals. VICE News looks at allegations of bias and harassment.

episodes.name: Wednesday, June 2, 2021
episodes.overview: The cease-fire between Israel and Hamas is holding after 11 days of fighting. VICE News talks with civilians confronting the devastation and with the leader of Hamas in Gaza.

episodes.name: Thursday, June 3, 2021
episodes.overview: One hundred years after the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre, the city is facing a public reckoning. VICE News asks descendants of victims and city officials what justice looks today.

episodes.name: Monday, June 7, 2021
episodes.overview: The U.S.-led coalition in Iraq is still fighting ISIS. VICE News embeds with Iraqi forces in the field and speaks with American military leaders about the future of the coalition.

episodes.name: Tuesday, June 8, 2021
episodes.overview: Thousands of intellectually and developmentally disabled people and their families are desperate for support in Pennsylvania. VICE News investigates how they are coping.

episodes.name: Thursday, June 10, 2021
episodes.overview: The U.S. military now allows open service for transgender troops. VICE News follows one sergeant as she prepares to transition and comes out to her commanding officer.

episodes.name: Monday, June 14, 2021
episodes.overview: Joe Biden and Vladimir Putin meet this week and are likely to discuss the ongoing war in Ukraine. VICE News speaks with soldiers and civilians on the front of that fight.

episodes.name: Tuesday, June 15, 2021
episodes.overview: Nuclear deal talks with Iran have restarted. VICE News goes inside Iran to investigate assassinations of nuclear scientists there and hears from the one scientist who survived.

episodes.name: Wednesday, June 16, 2021
episodes.overview: The 2020 Election was not stolen, but many Americans still want state reviews of the results. VICE News reports on a new Republican strategy: eroding confidence in elections.

episodes.name: Thursday, June 17, 2021
episodes.overview: As the U.S. withdraws from Afghanistan, the Taliban's influence is growing. VICE News gets exclusive access to Taliban territory in a special report: Under Taliban Rule.

episodes.name: Monday, June 21, 2021
episodes.overview: VICE News returns to Armenia after its latest conflict with Azerbaijan for an update on where things stand for the torn country and the disputed territory of Nagorno-Karabakh.

episodes.name: Tuesday, June 22, 2021
episodes.overview: Taiwan's biggest fruit buyer, China, abruptly banned Taiwanese pineapples in March. VICE News sees how Taiwan countered the move and made pineapples a symbol of resistance.

episodes.name: Wednesday, June 23, 2021
episodes.overview: Biden is proposing to replace all the country’s lead pipes, but how do you replace them when you don’t know where they are? VICE News investigates.

episodes.name: Thursday, June 24, 2021
episodes.overview: Children are fleeing Haiti's crisis, escaping over the border to the Dominican Republic. VICE News obtains video of bribes paid to border guards and hears from some child migrants.

episodes.name: Monday, June 28, 2021
episodes.overview: COVID-19 inflicted collective trauma globally. VICE News goes to where it all began—Wuhan, China—to see how the pandemic pushed people to discuss mental health and seek solutions.

episodes.name: Tuesday, June 29, 2021
episodes.overview: El Salvador is the first country to make Bitcoin a national currency. VICE News explores the plan and discusses whether it can revive the economy and give people a better life.

episodes.name: Wednesday, June 30, 2021
episodes.overview: The so-called Arizona audit has wrapped. VICE News looks at why Republicans pushed for the review of 2020 ballots and what's next for their strategy.

episodes.name: Thursday, July 1, 2021
episodes.overview: Tremé is the country's oldest Black neighborhood, but residents claim they have no say in New Orleans' plans for the area. VICE News talks with locals fighting a legacy of racism.

episodes.name: Monday, July 12, 2021
episodes.overview: A former Ugandan warlord was recently sentenced by the International Criminal Court. VICE News speaks with some victims of the Lord's Resistance Army as they ask what's next.

episodes.name: Tuesday, July 13, 2021
episodes.overview: French forces are drawing down from Mali after fighting jihadists for nearly a decade. VICE News is on the ground to learn why it's so hard to contain the terrorist threat there.

episodes.name: Wednesday, July 14, 2021
episodes.overview: Bloods and Crips are fighting deadly street wars in Belize—with civilian casualties. VICE News looks at how the U.S. gangs ended up there and how Belize is trying to stop them.

episodes.name: Thursday, July 15, 2021
episodes.overview: Ghost kitchens cook takeout for multiple virtual restaurants at once and thrived in the pandemic. VICE News talks with chefs and entrepreneurs behind this new breed of restaurants.

episodes.name: Monday, July 19, 2021
episodes.overview: Haiti's president Jovenel Moïse was assassinated earlier this month, leaving a power vacuum in a country already in chaos. VICE News is on the ground in Port-au-Prince.

episodes.name: Tuesday, July 20, 2021
episodes.overview: More than 80 people were killed in just one military attack in Myanmar in April. VICE News tracked down witnesses and social media posts to investigate how the massacre unfolded.

episodes.name: Wednesday, July 21, 2021
episodes.overview: The January 6th insurrection awakened America to the threat of domestic violent extremism. VICE News talks with DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas about why it's on the rise.

episodes.name: Thursday, July 22, 2021
episodes.overview: A Dreamer died in ICE custody after 19 straight days of solitary confinement. With access to leaked deposition tapes of high level ICE officials, VICE News investigates the death.

episodes.name: Monday, July 26, 2021
episodes.overview: Omar Ameen—a refugee accused of killing an Iraqi police officer for the Islamic State—is back in immigration court this week and could be deported. VICE News visits his family.

episodes.name: Tuesday, July 27, 2021
episodes.overview: Florida's schools, teachers, and parents are fighting over Critical Race Theory and how to teach kids about America's story. VICE News is on the frontline of the culture wars.

episodes.name: Wednesday, July 28, 2021
episodes.overview: In a remote region of Jamaica, some people are fighting to stop mining expansion. VICE News looks at how they're trying to save their livelihoods, land, water, and identity.

episodes.name: Thursday, July 29, 2021
episodes.overview: “A sports event that will be our death, for what?” VICE goes to Japan where an anti-Olympic movement is gaining steam as COVID infections reach new records.

episodes.name: Monday, August 2, 2021
episodes.overview: Colombia’s police are allegedly illegally detaining and torturing protesters. VICE News speaks with victims and survivors.

episodes.name: Tuesday, August 3, 2021
episodes.overview: Edgar Lopez worked at a food processing factory but was deported after an immigration raid. VICE News looks at his attempts to reunite with his family, and his death.

episodes.name: Wednesday, August 4, 2021
episodes.overview: The Biden Administration is extending a moratorium on evictions. VICE News speaks with Rep. Cori Bush, who protested to protect those who would've lost their homes.

episodes.name: Thursday, August 5, 2021
episodes.overview: A group of Oregonians want to shift their rural county borders and become part of Idaho, a state they feel represents their values better. VICE News hears their side.
